Description: Large crescentic axe-head: of shallow wide-edged form, bearing hooked lugs at the exterior tips of its lateral tangs. It has nine binding-holes, three in each tang. Characteristically, the lateral tangs expand towards the rear. There are pronounced flanges around the scallops on the inner edge. The piece is moderately corroded. Traces of the original wooden haft survive and the remains of some organic material are preserved in the corrosion product on one face.
Curator's comments: Metallographic analysis has shown that after casting the blade was probably finished by hot working and that the cutting edge was used.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (93)
